question_text: Which of the following are best practices when terminating twisted pair cables with RJ45 connectors? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Trim all wires to the same length before insertion
Use the same wiring standard on both ends of the cable
Untwist pairs completely to ease insertion
Ensure wires are pushed fully into the connector
Use pliers to compress the connector evenly
correct_answer: Trim all wires to the same length before insertion
Use the same wiring standard on both ends of the cable
Ensure wires are pushed fully into the connector
explanation: Consistent wiring standards, proper trimming, and full wire insertion are essential for a functional cable. Pliers are not suitable for even compression; a proper crimping tool should be used.
